channel.title: Project Members on
channel.description: Recent content in Project Members on

item.title: Invite Users to Join Projects
item.description:
This section explains how to invite users to join a project.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a project and have the Member Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

  • Invited users should have joined the workspace to which the project belongs.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Project Members in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Invite on the right side of the page.

  4. In the Invite Member dialog, click next to the user you want to invite. Select the role of the user in the project from the dropdown list, then click OK.

    KubeSphere provides the following preset project roles:

item.title: View Project Member List
item.description:
This section explains how to view the project member list.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Member Viewing permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Viewing permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Project Members in the left navigation pane.

    • The project member list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Username

item.title: Change Project Member Roles
item.description:
This section explains how to change the role of a project member.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Member Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Project Members in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the project member you want to edit, click , then select Change Role.

  4. In the Change Role dialog, set the role for the project member from the dropdown list, then click OK.

    KubeSphere provides the following preset project roles:

item.title: Remove Project Members
item.description:
This section explains how to remove a project member.

Note

Once a user is removed from the project, they will lose the permissions provided by the project role.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Member Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Project Members in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the project member you want to remove, click , then select Remove.

  4. In the Remove Member dialog, enter the username of the project member, then click OK.

    Once the project member is removed, they will no longer appear in the project member list.
